column4: I downloaded a .deb file that was compiled for sarge, and I'm trying to install in on breezy.  It seems to be OK, apart from one dependancy...
It wants "libzipios++0c102", but I have "libzipios++0".  Can I tell dkpg not to worry, and install anyway?
is there a debian version which has a binary compatible C++ interface with breezy?
the sarge package is built with g++ 3, it won't work if your libraries are build with g++ 4
isn't enigma in ubuntu universe, too?
oh, wesnoth does use zipios, too? ;-) didn't know that.
yes, and it's in debian unstable, too. but that is not the version you were trying to install...
debian unstable only has a release candidate?
1.0 was uploaded the day before yesterday
